ProductOverview.Summary: OpenClinic GA is an open source integrated hospital information management system covering management of administrative, financial, clinical, lab, x-ray, pharmacy, meals distribution, and other data. Extensive statistical and reporting capabilities.
ProductOverview.Description: This system is a highly customizable health information platform with integrated billing (supporting Central African, East African, and Peruvian insurance schemes), clinical coding (ICD-10, ICPC-2, SNOMED CT, LOINC, RxNorm), and comprehensive modules for patient administration, human resources, scheduling, pharmacy, laboratory, imaging, and pathology. It supports advanced statistics on mortality, co-morbidity, and care costs, as well as multimedia records, fingerprint identification, drug interaction checks, and mobile access with barcode scanning. It also offers HL7 integration with lab analyzers, efficient database performance, and multilingual capabilities.
ProductOverview.PrimaryFunctionality: Comprehensive hospital information management system with integrated billing and clinical coding

Reach.SummaryOfReach: 500+ implementations: Rwanda,  DRC, Mali and Burundi covering hospitals with 5 up to 700 users. Country specific localizations for Albania, Bangladesh, Belgium, Benin, Brazil, Burundi, Cameroon, Congo-Brazzaville, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Gabon, Ivory Coast, Kenya, Mali, Niger, Nigeria, Senegal, Rwanda, Uganda, Peru, Sri Lanka, Tanzania and Zambia.

Maturity.SummaryOfMaturity: All maturity model assessments are self-reported by the funded organization leading the development of the global good.  The scores for Inclusive Design, Climate Resilience and Low Carbon are not available as this assessment was done using the previous version of the maturity model.

Community.DescriptionOfCommunity: OpenClinic GA is developed and maintained by a global community focused on hospital information systems.

HostAnchorOrganization.name: OpenClinic Foundation
HostAnchorOrganization.description: Open source hospital information system foundation

Sustainability.Description: GRANT Developpement partners: WHO,UNDP, ENABEL,GIZ, LUXDEV, VUB, OpenClinic Foundation

collectionInitiative.label: Digital Public Goods Alliance
collectionInitiative.description: A multi-stakeholder initiative to accelerate the attainment of the Sustainable Development Goals in low- and middle-income countries by facilitating the discovery, development, use of, and investment in digital public goods.

collectionInitiative.label: DIAL Exchange
collectionInitiative.description: A platform by the Digital Impact Alliance to connect digital public goods and solutions for global development.
